step1.sentence: It took her years of therapy to learn how to express feelings without shutting down.

step2.story: Jake had always bottled everything up, but after his best friend moved away, he realized he needed to express feelings before they consumed him. He sat down and wrote a long, honest letter. By the time he sealed the envelope, he felt lighter than he had in months.

step3.story: Growing up in a household where vulnerability was seen as weakness, Mina never learned to express feelings openly. At work, colleagues admired her composure, but inside she felt like a pressure cooker about to burst. One evening, her partner gently asked why she always said 'I'm fine' when she clearly wasn't. That question cracked something open. Mina started small — texting how her day really went instead of the usual 'good.' Over time, learning to express feelings honestly transformed not just her relationship, but her entire sense of self.

meaning.literalMeaningKo: 감정을 표현하다 — 자신이 느끼는 감정을 말이나 행동으로 드러내는 것을 뜻합니다.
meaning.realUsageKo: 일상에서 자신의 기쁨, 슬픔, 분노 등의 감정을 솔직하게 전달할 때 사용합니다. 특히 감정을 억누르지 않고 건강하게 소통하는 맥락에서 자주 쓰입니다.
meaning.etymologyKo: express는 라틴어 exprimere(밖으로 누르다)에서 유래했고, feelings는 고대 영어 fēlan(느끼다)에서 왔습니다. 즉, 내면의 감정을 밖으로 꺼내 보여준다는 의미입니다.
meaning.nuanceKo: 단순히 감정을 '말하다'보다 더 적극적이고 의식적인 표현 행위를 암시합니다. 심리 상담, 자기계발, 대인관계 맥락에서 긍정적 뉘앙스로 자주 사용됩니다.
meaning.shortExampleEn: Children should be encouraged to express feelings in a healthy way.
meaning.shortExampleKo: 아이들이 건강한 방식으로 감정을 표현하도록 격려해야 합니다.
